DataElement.preferredName: Graft Cell Monoclonal Antibody Manipulation Prior Infusion Procedure Occurrence Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free-text field to specify the type of monoclonal antibody, an antibody produced by a clone or genetically homogenous fast growing cells i.e., hybridoma; hybridoma cells are cloned to establish cell lines producing a specific antibody that is chemically and immunologically homogeneous, used to alter cells to be transplanted from a donor to a recipient prior to infusion, a method of putting fluids or drugs into the bloodstream, of the recipient.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Graft Cell Monoclonal Antibody Manipulation Prior Infusion Procedure Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the alteration of cells to be transplanted from a donor to a recipient using a monoclonal antibody, an antibody produced by a clone or genetically homogenous fast growing cells i.e., hybridoma; hybridoma cells are cloned to establish cell lines producing a specific antibody that is chemically and immunologically homogeneous, prior to infusion, a method of putting fluids or drugs into the bloodstream, of the recipient.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Healthy skin, bone, or other tissue taken from one part of the body and used to replace diseased or injured tissue removed from another part of the body.:The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid. Cells are highly variable and specialized in both structure and function, though all must at some stage replicate proteins and nucleic acids, utilize energy, and reproduce themselves.

Concepts.definition: Tissue or organ transplanted from a donor to a recipient.
The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.

Property.preferredName: Monoclonal Antibody Manipulation Prior Infusion Occurrence
Property.preferredDefinition: An antibody produced by a clone or genetically homogenous population of hybrid cells i.e., hybridoma; hybrid cells are cloned to establish cell lines producing a specific antibody that is chemically and immunologically homogeneous. They are widely used in cancer detection, diagnosis and treatment.:Move, treat, or operate with the hands or by mechanical means, especially in a skillful manner.:Earlier in time or order.:A method of putting fluids, including drugs, into the bloodstream. Also called intravenous infusion.:Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

Concepts.definition: An antibody produced by a clone or genetically homogenous fast-growing cells i.e., hybridoma. Hybridoma cells are cloned to establish cell lines producing a specific antibody that is chemically and immunologically homogeneous. They are widely used in cancer detection, diagnosis, and treatment.
Move, treat, or operate with the hands or by mechanical means, especially in a skillful manner.
Any form of treatment that is introduced into the body via a blood vessel, a muscle, or the spinal cord.
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the free text field related to therapy.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: released as entered during ISO compliance update
